training_organizations.name: Connecticut DCF Academy for Workforce Development
training_organizations.description: The Connecticut Department of Children and Families’ training academy, which offers comprehensive training to new and veteran CPS staff. It covers Connecticut’s practice model, family engagement strategies, legal procedures, and provides professional development to continually build workforce skills.

training_organizations.name: Connecticut Alliance of Foster and Adoptive Families (CAFAF)
training_organizations.description: A nonprofit organization contracted by Connecticut DCF to support foster, adoptive, and kinship families. CAFAF provides pre-service training for prospective foster/adoptive parents, runs support groups and respite programs, and helps families navigate services – improving retention of foster homes and stability for children.

training_organizations.name: Safe & Together Institute
training_organizations.description: A private organization providing domestic violence-informed practice training. Connecticut was an early adopter of the Safe & Together model, working with this institute to train CPS workers on how to better partner with non-offending parents and hold batterers accountable, thereby improving child safety in homes with domestic violence.

perpetrator_relationships.relationship: Victim Was Child of Boyfriend or Girlfriend

title_iv_e_foster_care.recipient_name: THE CHILDREN'S COMMUNITY PROGRAMS OF CONNECTICUT, INC.

refugee_assistance.recipient_name: THE CHILDREN'S COMMUNITY PROGRAMS OF CONNECTICUT, INC.

policies.TribalFoster: No, Tribes within state do not provide foster care
policies.DefAge_Specify: Under age 18 and up to 21 if in the care of the agency and variability over 18
policies.ReportAnonymous: General public (not mandated reporters) can remain anonymous
policies.FatalitiesReview: Yes, reviews are required for all or some cases
policies.Def_Subtype_Abuse: Abuse includes malnutrition, sexual molestation or exploitation, deprivation of necessities, emotional maltreatment, and cruel punishment
policies.Def_Subtype_Neglect: Neglect includes abandonment, living in injurious environment, inadequate supervision, educational neglect, emotional neglect, and moral neglect
policies.EquityStaff_Specify: The Office of Multicultural Affairs and Immigration Practice; The Department of Children and Families Office of Diversity and Equity (DFC ODE)
policies.NearFatalitiesReview: Yes, reviews can be conducted but are not required
policies.Penalty_OtherSpecify: Participate in an educational and training program
policies.Reporter_OtherSpecify: Licensed behavioral analyst; Any victim services advocate, family relations counselor, family relations counselor trainee or family services supervisor employed by the Judicial Department; Facility employee where children under eighteen years of age are detained and who has direct contact with children; Juvenile detention employees, including any person under contract and any independent ombudsperson.
policies.InvestQual_OtherSpecify: Possess and retain a valid Motor Vehicle Operator's License and must be able to communicate fluently in American Sign Language
policies.ScreenInfo_OtherSpecify: For all subjects of a report, the following information is obtained, if possible: (1) name and location of non-custodial parent, (2) names of siblings or other children living in or out of the home, and (3) any known information about household members and extended family members
policies.EquityStaff_OtherSpecify: Advising the DCF Commissioner and the Senior Management Team regarding strategies to eliminate disproportionality and disparities in referral rates, substantiations, placements and retention among racial and ethnic groups known to experience higher rates of adverse child welfare, health and services outcomes because of religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, socioeconomic status, immigration status, language, ancestry, intellectual or physical disability, mental health status, prior criminal convictions, homelessness, gender identity or expression or geographic areas of residence; Drafting an annual report detailing DCF's progress in eliminating disparities and disproportionality across DCF's mandates, reviewing, advising and making recommendations for expanding existing training programs for building staff capacity and development of skills for supporting racial justice practice, providing consultation with respect to establishing and maintaining a standardized data reporting system to support collection of data regarding the race and ethnicity of children and families referred to DCF at key decision points, including, but not limited to referral, substantiation, removal and placement; Working collaboratively with the Division of Diversity and Equity to develop and support Diversity Action and Racial Justice Teams across the state; Monitoring statewide immigrant and refugee data and trends to support recommendations for resource allocation, training, practice and policy changes; Consulting with DCF leadership and staff and public and private service providers and stakeholders to determine organizational and client linguistic and diversity needs, including deaf and hard of hearing populations; Providing consultation and support for: Nonimmigrant Status I-918 B petitions; Matters related to obtaining out-of-country travel documents for children in care; Interactions with state and federal immigration enforcement regarding refugee resettlement; Matters pertaining to the Unaccompanied Minor Program; Facilitating requests of birth certificates for children born in Puerto Rico; Providing human diversity and culturally complex case consultation, immigration practice guidance, Culturally and Linguistically Appropriate Services (CLAS) Standards Language access resources, education and training. The staff of the DCF ODE shall provide information and counsel employees with questions or concerns about DCF's anti-discrimination policies.
policies.DefHarm_VaryByTypeSpecify: Definition of abuse outlines the types of injuries, (i.e., physical injury or injuries other than by accidental means, injuries that are at variance with the history given of them, conditions that result in malnutrition, emotional maltreatment, etc.); Definitions of a neglected child and an uncared for child speak to conditions (i.e., being denied proper care, being in a home that cannot provide specialized care, living in specified conditions, etc.), but the type of injury or harm is not specified
policies.ScreenerQual_OtherSpecify: Possess and retain a valid Motor Vehicle Operator's License and must be able to communicate fluently in American Sign Language
policies.CaseManagerQual_OtherSpecify: Incumbents in this class will be required to possess and retain a valid Motor Vehicle Operator's License and must be able to communicate fluently in American Sign Language
policies.InvestQual_ExperienceSpecify: A master's degree in social work or a closely related field and one (1) year of experience in the self-directed use of case management techniques and counseling to sustain or restore client functioning OR a bachelor's degree in social work or a closely related field and two (2) years of experience in the self-directed use of case management techniques and counseling to sustain or restore client functioning. For state employees successful completion of the Social Worker Trainee program may be substituted for the General Experience
policies.ReporterPenalty_OtherSpecify: Licensed behavioral analyst; Any victim services advocate, family relations counselor, family relations counselor trainee or family services supervisor employed by the Judicial Department; Facility employee where children under eighteen years of age are detained and who has direct contact with children; Juvenile detention employees, including any person under contract and any independent ombudsperson.
policies.ScreenerQual_TrainingSpecify: Topics include intimate partner violence, Structured Decision Making safety and risk assessment, safety planning, child trafficking, substance use, and drug endangered children
policies.CaseManagerQual_ExperienceSpec: 1 year of experience in the self-directed use of case management techniques and counseling to sustain or restore client functioning with a master's degree; 2 years of experience in the self-directed use of case management techniques and counseling to sustain or restore client functioning with a bachelor's degree. For state employees successful completion of the Social Worker Trainee program may be substituted for the General Experience
policies.InvestReq_MedEvalCases_Specify: If during the course of the investigation, child is removed from parental care, agency is required to provide the child with all necessary care, "including medical care, which may include an examination by a physician or mental health professional with or without the consent of the child's parents, guardian or other person responsible for the child's care, provided reasonable attempts have been made to obtain consent of the child's parents or guardian or other person responsible for the care of such child. During the course of a medical examination, a physician may perform diagnostic tests and procedures necessary for the detection of child abuse or neglect."
policies.ScreenerQual_ExperienceSpecify: A master's degree in social work or a closely related field and one (1) year of experience in the self-directed use of case management techniques and counseling to sustain or restore client functioning OR a bachelor's degree in social work or a closely related field and two (2) years of experience in the self-directed use of case management techniques and counseling to sustain or restore client functioning. For state employees successful completion of the Social Worker Trainee program may be substituted for the General Experience.
policies.AltResp_EligibilityMaltreatment: Only certain types of maltreatment are eligible
policies.AltResp_EligibilityRiskToolSpec: Structured Decision Making Screening and Response Priority Tools
policies.ExtFosterCare_Reentry_OtherSpec: Left care after age 18 but before age 23; Not married; Not on active duty with any of the armed forces; Incarcerated or detained youth must have been in a DCF out-of-home placement immediately prior to detention or incarceration and be a prior DCF youth who is requesting re-entry under an exception
policies.AltResp_EligibilityRiskOtherSpec: Lower risk reports classified by 72-hr response time designations
policies.AltResp_Eligibility_OtherSpecify: A case that is not a new Child Protection Services report on an active ongoing services case; Cases that are not involved in congregate care, foster care, or persons entrusted; Cases without previous adjudication of abuse or neglect in Superior Court of Juvenile Matters or comparable out-of-state-court, including prior termination of parental rights (TPR)
policies.ExtendedFosterCare_Age_OtherSpec: Up to age 23 (until 23rd birthday), if the individual is in school continuously, if they can establish that they are in need of additional services, or if they are incarcerated or detained
policies.InvestReq_PerpInterviewCase_Spec: If the alleged perpetrator agrees to participate; In joint investigations with police, best efforts should be made to coordinate the interview with the alleged perpetrator, however, Department of Children and Families (DCF) is required to pursue an interview with the alleged perpetrator prior to case closing
